operations.name: GetCategories

fields.description: Parameter for requesting optional response properties

member.description: order by recommendations for authorized member (deprecated)

operations.summary: Returns a list of Meetup group categories
operations.notes: No parameters required parameters

operations.name: GetTopicCategories

lat.description: Use a given lat/lon/radius (miles) to search best_topics for instead of using the member's lat/lon.  When present, all three are required.

lon.description: Use a given lat/lon/radius (miles) to search best_topics for instead of using the member's lat/lon.  When present, all three are required.

radius.description: Use a given lat/lon/radius (miles) to search best_topics for instead of using the member's lat/lon.  When present, all three are required.

fields.description: Parameter for requesting optional response properties

operations.summary: Returns a list of Meetup topic categories
operations.notes: No parameters required parameters

operations.name: GetOpenEvents

state.description: If searching in a country with states, a valid 2 character state code

status.description: Status may be "upcoming", "past" or both separated by a comma. The default is "upcoming" only

lon.description: A valid longitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles

lat.description: A valid latitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles

text.description: Events that contain the given term or terms somewhere in their content. The terms are OR'd by default. Separate terms with " AND " for events that have combined terms. To have terms automatically AND'd, set the "and_text" to true

text_format.description: Format of the description text, "html" or "plain". Defaults to "html"

topic.description: Return events in the specified topic or topics specified by commas. This is the topic "urlkey" returned by the Topics method. If all supplied topics are unknown, a 400 error response is returned with the code "badtopic".

category.description: Return events in the specified category or categories specified by commas. This is the category id returned by the Categories method.

zip.description: A valid US zip code, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

radius.description: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, default 25.0 -- maximum 100. May also be specified as "smart", a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area

and_text.description: Changes the interpretation of the "text" field from OR'd terms to AND'd terms

limited_events.description: Include limited event information for private groups that wish to expose only a small amount of information about their events. This includes just: id, name, utc_offset, time, duration, yes_rsvp_count, waitlist_count, group, visibility, timezone. Value must be true or false.

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

trending.description: you will likely want to specify "desc=true" to get the best trending results first.

distance.description: ordering is approximate and will not exactly match the values in the "distance" field.

operations.summary: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
operations.notes:
At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request.

For geo-based requests, you may provide a location in one of three ways. By `lat` and `lon`, by `zip`, or by `country`, `city`, and optionally a `state`, if the provided country has states.

Some groups, while remaining private, still wish to show some information about their events. You can include these events in results using the `limited_events` request parameter.

operations.name: GetConcierge

zip.description: A valid US zip code, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

lon.description: A valid longitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles

with_friends.description: Boolean parameter. When set to true, events hosted by groups you have friends in will be recommended

page_token.description: An opaque string used to page through results. This can be found appended to the 'next' link in the meta section of the response.

state.description: If searching in a country with states, a valid 2 character state code

category_id.description: Comma delimited list of category ids to limit recommendations to

time.description: ascending time is the default and only ordering

text_format.description: Format of the description text, "html", "plain", or "simplehtml". Defaults to "html"

self_groups.description: set to "include" or "exclude" groups the authorized member belongs to. The default is "include". This includes groups in locations that may differ than the provided location

radius.description: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, defaults to the member's preferred radius or 0.5 -- maximum 100. May also be specified as "smart", a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area

topic_id.description: Comma delimited list of topics to help inform recommendation

lat.description: A valid latitude, limits the returned group events to those within radius miles

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

operations.summary: Recommends upcoming meetups for the authorized member in a given location and in thier groups
operations.notes:
For geo-based requests, you may provide a location in one of three ways. By `lat` and `lon`, by `zip`, or by `country`, `city`, and optionally a `state`, if the provided country has states.

If the server is unable to produce recommendations in a suitable amount of time, a 503 error will be returned. If no parameters are specified, Meetups are recommended for the upcoming week in the member's default location.

Pagination works a little differently in this method than in others. Rather than using "offset" and "page" request parameters, this method uses an opaque "page_token" request parameter to determine the page of results returned. If there are more results, the "next" property of the [meta section](/meetup_api/docs/#meta) of the response will contain the next page's page_token. The number of results returned is not deterministic but a best-effort attempt will be made to return at least some.

operations.name: GetGroups

topic.description: Only return groups in the specified topic [one topic allowed]

groupnum.description: Return the group with this topic and number

group_id.description: one or more separated by commas

domain.description: one or more custom group domains, separated by commas

group_urlname.description: one or more separated by commas, includes no slashes

country.description: A valid country code, city and for the US, State. limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

city.description: A valid country code, city and for the US, State. limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

state.description: A valid country code, city and for the US, State. limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

member_id.description: one or more separated by commas, for groups this member belongs to

lat.description: A valid latitude and longitude, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

lon.description: A valid latitude and longitude, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles

zip.description: A valid US zip code, limits the returned groups to those within radius miles.

category_id.description: Only return groups in the specified category. [one category allowed]

radius.description: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, default 25 -- maximum 100

organizer_id.description: one or more organizer IDs, separated by commas

fields.description: optional result fields, separated by commas.

location.description: group location, country, state [if present], city

operations.summary: Fetch information about Meetup Groups.
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request. Answers to questions are expected to follow the naming convention: answer_{question_id}=myanswer when joining with the [Profile Create](/meetup_api/docs/2/profile) method.

operations.name: GetEvents

status.description: Status may be "upcoming", "past", "proposed", "suggested", "cancelled", "draft" or multiple separated by a comma. The default is "upcoming", which includes Meetups that are happening now according to their **duration**. Meetups that are "proposed" or "suggested" do not have a date assigned; the former are listed on the site as official while the latter appear as in the making. Drafts are only visible to organizers of groups hosting the events.

rsvp.description: Filters events by the currently authenticated member's RSVP status. May be a comma delimited list of "yes", "no", "waitlist", "maybe" or "none"

group_id.description: Multiple ids may be separated with commas

event_id.description: Multiple ids may be separated with commas

group_urlname.description: Path to group from meetup.com, no slashes

venue_id.description: Multiple ids may be separated with commas

member_id.description: Single member id, to find events in this member's groups

text_format.description: Format of the description text, "html" or "plain". Defaults to "html"

limited_events.description: Include limited event information for private groups that wish to expose only a small amount of information about their events. This includes just: id, name, utc_offset, time, duration, yes_rsvp_count, waitlist_count, group, visibility, timezone. Value must be true or false.

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

operations.summary: Access Meetup events using a group, member, or event id. Events in private groups are available only to authenticated members of those groups. To search events by topic or location, see [Open Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/open_events).
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request. Some groups, while remaining private, still wish to show some information about their events. You can include these events in results using the `limited_events` request parameter.

operations.name: EventCreate

rsvp_limit.description: Total number of RSVPs available for the event

rsvp_close.description: Users with permission may set the RSVP close time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

guest_limit.description: Number of guests members may include in their RSVP, 0 or more

name.description: Name of the event. May not be longer than 80 characters.

rsvp_open.description: Users with permission may set the RSVP open time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

question_{index}.description: Those with permission may include up to 6 survey questions for the event with each being up to 250 characters. See the parameter notes section for more information

publish_status.description: If you are an organizer of the group, you may set this to "draft" to save the event as a draft. Doing so will require a status=draft filter on /2/event queries.

group_urlname.description: URL name of the Group hosting the event

email_reminders.description: Limited to organizers and event hosts, if false, disables event reminders

duration.description: Event duration in milliseconds. When not specified, a default of 3 hours may be assumed by applications. To clear event duration, set this to 0

time.description: Event start time in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

venue_visibility.description: Controls the visibility of the event venue for non members of the hosting group. May be one of "public" or "members"

waitlisting.description: Waiting list status may be one of: auto, manual, off

description.description: Longer description of the event, in HTML. May not be longer than 50000 characters.

how_to_find_us.description: The information provided by the event host for "How will members find you there?". Visible when location is visible to the authenticated member

hosts.description: Up to 5 comma-separated valid member ids to be hosts for the event. If hosts is not provided, the authorized member is the default host

host_instructions.description: optional set of instructions to provide to hosts, only used when hosts are provided

rsvp_alerts.description: Limited to organizers and event hosts, if false, disables member RSVP alerts

simple_html_description.description: Description of the event, in simple HTML format. This value is translated to HTML to update the description. May not be longer than 50000 characters.

why.description: We should do this because... May not be longer than 250 characters.

operations.notes:
All required parameters must be supplied. This method requires parameters encoded in application/x-www-form-urlencoded format as an HTTP POST.

Survey questions may be submitted in the format "question_{index}=questiontext" where "index" is an integer representing the order the questions should be presented in. e.g. question_0=question1&question_1=question2.

Organizers of the hosting group may optionally save this event as a draft by setting "publish_status" to "draft". Drafts are then discoverable using the [/2/events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events) API setting the "status" request parameter to "draft"

operations.name: EventEdit

rsvp_close.description: Users with permission may set the RSVP close time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format. To unset rsvp_close, set this to 0

announce.description: Organizers and hosts may set this to true to announce a Meetup.

announce_message.description: Organizers and hosts may provide an optional message in this field when announcing a Meetup. May not be longer than 500 characters.

publish_status.description: If you are an organizer of the group, you may set this to "draft" or "published". Setting state to "draft" will require a status=draft filter on /2/event queries.

email_reminders.description: Limited to organizers and event hosts, if false, disables event reminders

time.description: event start time in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

venue_visibility.description: Controls the visibility of venue. May be one of "public" or "members"

description.description: Longer description of the event, in HTML. May not be longer than 50000 characters.

name.description: Event name. May not be longer than 80 characters.

hosts.description: Up to 5 valid member ids to be hosts for the event.

venue_id.description: Numeric identifier of a venue. To unset the event's venue, set this to 0

rsvp_alerts.description: Limited to organizers and event hosts, if false, disables member RSVP alerts

rsvp_limit.description: Total number of RSVPs available for the event. To remove this limit, set this to 0

lat.description: Updates to the venue's latitude and longitude. When present, both must be provided

lon.description: Updates to the venue's latitude and longitude. When present, both must be provided

question_edit_{id}.description: Those with permission may include up to 6 survey questions with each being up to 250 characters, including new questions. To delete a question submit this parameter with an empty value

guest_limit.description: number of guests members may include in their RSVP, 0 or more

rsvp_open.description: Users with permission may set the RSVP open time for the event. The time may be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

question_{index}.description: Those with permission may include up to 6 survey questions with each being up to 250 characters, including edited questions, for the event. See the parameter notes section for more information

duration.description: Event duration in milliseconds. When not specified, a default of 3 hours may be assumed by applications. To clear event duration, set this to 0

waitlisting.description: Waiting list status may be one of: auto, manual, off

how_to_find_us.description: The information provided by the event host for "How will members find you there?". Visible when location is visible to the authenticated member

host_instructions.description: optional set of instructions to provide to hosts, only used when hosts are provided

simple_html_description.description: Description of the event, in simple HTML format. This value is translated to HTML to update the description. May not be longer than 50000 characters.

why.description: We should do this because... May not be longer than 250 characters.

operations.summary: Update an existing Meetup
operations.notes:
All parameters are optional. This method requires an HTTP POST.

If a lat & lon are provided, the event's venue will be updated accordingly.

Survey questions may be submitted in the format "question_{index}=questiontext" where "index" is an integer representing the order the questions should be presented in. e.g. question_0=question1&question_1=question2.

To view existing survey questions supply the request parameter fields=survey_questions with the [Event Get](#get) To edit questions you may submit questions in the format "question_edit_{id}=updatedquestion" where id is the id of the question. To clear an existing question for the event survey, just submit question_edit_{id} with an empty value.

Organizers may publish a draft event by posting with the "publish_status" request parameter set to "published". Organizers and hosts of the event may also optionally announce an unannounced event by posting with the "announce" request parameter set to "true"

operations.name: GetEventGet

text_format.description: Format of the description in the response, "html" or "plain". Defaults to "html"

limited_events.description: Include limited event information for private groups that wish to expose only a small amount of information about their events. This includes just: id, name, utc_offset, time, duration, yes_rsvp_count, waitlist_count, group, visibility, timezone. Value must be true or false.

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

operations.summary: Retrieve a single meetup
operations.notes: Only authorization parameters are needed. Some groups, while remaining private, still wish to show some information about their events. You can include these events in results using the `limited_events` request parameter.

operations.name: EventDelete
operations.summary: Deletes a specified meetup
operations.notes: Only authorization parameters are needed.

operations.name: GetCities

query.description: Search term and/or zip to look for (if this is specified, max result size limited to 10)

state.description: A valid state code for the given country, if the country has states

radius.description: When searching by lat/lon only, specify a radius to search (default 50 miles)

distance.description: When lat/lon/query provided, sort matches by distance to coordinates

smart.description: Sort by size, but if a match is close to given lat/lon, float to top. Only works when query provided

size.description: (default order) number of members in the city: descending

operations.summary: Returns Meetup cities. This method supports search by latitude/longitude/radius, by country/state, by query term/zip, or a combination of all of these. Location-only searches by lat and lon return all cities within a radius of the provided coordinates. Searches with a query return up to 10 cities matching the term, and can be sorted by size or distance to a given coordinate. 'smart' ordering can be used to return the match(es) with the highest member_count, unless a smaller size match exists nearby the given coordinates. Query searches are supported for country but not country and state
operations.notes: This method requires no authentication but is subject to [request limiting](/meetup_api/docs/#limits) based on client IP . This search is location based. A lat and lon must be supplied together or a query or the search will be based on your geo-located ip

operations.name: GetMembers

member_id.description: Return the member with this ID

group_id.description: Return members in groups with these ID numbers, separated by commas

service.description: Match users by the external services they've linked to their member account, specified as "servicename:identifier". For example, "service=twitter:@MeetupAPI" finds any member account that lists @MeetupAPI as its Twitter name (none, currently). You can query against several at a time by separating them with commas. Facebook identifiers should be provided as numeric values

group_urlname.description: Return members for the group with the given custom URL path

topic.description: Return members for the group with given topic and number

groupnum.description: Return members for the group with given topic and number

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

name.description: the name of the member (default order)

operations.summary: API method for accessing members of Meetup Groups
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request. If any of the groups you specify are private, you will not see its members listed in the result set unless you are a member of that group.

operations.name: GetMemberGet

fields.description: comma-separate list of optional fields

operations.summary: Retrieve a single member
operations.notes: Only authorization parameters are needed.

operations.name: MemberEdit

birthday.description: Day you were born. Format should be in the form of yyyy or mmddyyyy. A value of -1 indicates that birthday data should be cleared.

topics_privacy.description: Controls the visibility of the member's topics. May be one of hidden, visible

hometown.description: Hometown of member. Can not be longer than 64 characters

remove_topics.description: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to remove from your alert list

bio_privacy.description: Controls the visibility of the member's bio. May be one of hidden, visible

messaging_pref.description: This specifies the member's preference for being contacted from members on the site. Possible values are "orgs_only" meaning only group organizers can contact you, "groups_only" meaning only members of your group can contact you, or "all_members" meaning all members may contact you.

photos_privacy.description: Controls the visibility of the member's photos. May be one of hidden, visible

lang.description: Language preference used on the site. Valid values are en_us, de, es, fr, it, pt

country.description: Valid country code for your location

sync_photo.description: When set to true, this parameter will sync all of the group profile photos for the member with the provided photo_id

groups_privacy.description: Controls the visibility of the member's groups. May be one of hidden, visible

bio.description: Free form text passage about you. must be less than 250 characters

name.description: The name of the current member

gender.description: Your gender (used for better recommendations). Valid values are be one of none, other, female, male

radius.description: radius, in miles to search for city given a lat and lon. default 25.0, max 100.0

facebook_privacy.description: Controls the visibility of the member's facebook connection. May be one of hidden, visible. If the member has not connected their Facebook account, attempts to set this preference will do nothing.

photo_id.description: A valid photo_id from the member's photos to set as the main profile photo. A value of 0 will unset the current photo

add_topics.description: Comma-delimited list of topics ids to add to your alert list

operations.summary: Edit the authorized member's attributes
operations.notes: This method requires tls. Only the authorized user may edit their own properties. A city may be provided by either a city_id or a combination of lat and lon

operations.name: MessageCreate

hide_email.description: Hides sender's email from receiving member, defaults to false

cc_sender.description: Sends a copy of the message to the sender, defaults to true.

group_id.description: ID of group that sender has relationship with member in

dryrun.description: Performs request without sending message. Useful for pre-testing error conditions.

operations.summary: This method allows messaging-authorized requests to send messages between members
operations.notes: This method requires an HTTP POST and OAuth authorization in combination with the __messaging__ [permission scope](/meetup_api/auth/#oauth2-scopes). All required parameters must be supplied. You can call this method with __dryrun__ set to true if you wish to test the validation logic before sending the actual request

operations.name: GetProfiles

status.description: Status filter for members. Only organizers may see pending. Request must also contain a `group_id` or `group_urlname`. Status may be one of active, pending

group_id.description: Return profiles in the group with this ID

role.description: if "leads", only profiles for members of the leadership team are included

group_urlname.description: Return profiles for the group with the given custom URL path

fields.description: comma delimited list of optional response properties. A value of "membership_dues" will populate membership dues for the authorized user or members of the groups the authorized user organizes

visited.description: last visit to group pages (default order)

interesting.description: Order which may be interesting to the authorized member

operations.summary: This method returns member *profiles* associated with a particular group. Meetup members have separate profiles for each group they join.
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request. If any of the groups you specify are private, you will not see its members listed in the result set unless you are a member of that group. If querying for member_id alone, the member's 'hide groups' preference will be honored. 'Interesting' ordered searches only support searching by group_urlname or group_id. Only one of those may be supplied.

operations.name: ProfileCreate(GroupJoin)

answer_{qid}.description: Answers to questions from groups API join_info question fields

new_photo.description: file upload for a new member photo

site_name.description: Name of member's site. Max length is 32

photo_id.description: photo_id of the photo to use for this profile

intro.description: Provides a Member an opportunity to tell the group about themselves

site_url.description: Link to member's site. Max length is 80

operations.summary: This method allows an authenticated member to join a group by creating a profile
operations.notes: This method requires an HTTP POST. All required parameters must be supplied. An intro and answers may be required based on the group the member is joining. To find out if a group requires an intro or answers to questions, query for the group through one of the [Groups methods](/meetup_api/docs/2/groups) providing setting the __fields__ parameter to __join_info__ and inspecting the __join_info__ in the results. Answers to the questions must be named using the convention __answer_{question_id}__.

operations.name: ProfileEdit

answer_{qid}.description: Answers to questions from groups API join_info question fields

remove_role.description: Allows those with permission to remove one of the following roles: event_organizer, coorganizer, assistant_organizer

new_photo.description: file upload for a new member photo

site_name.description: Name of member's site. Max length is 32

photo_id.description: photo_id of the photo to use for this profile. set to 0 to unset the current photo

add_role.description: Allows those with permission to assign one of the following roles: event_organizer, coorganizer, assistant_organizer

intro.description: Provides a Member an opportunity to tell the group about themselves

site_url.description: Link to member's site. Max length is 80

operations.summary: Update a member's group profile
operations.notes: The `gid` and `mid` in this method's path are group and member IDs, both needed to uniquely identify the member profile to be edited. An authenticated user may update their own profile by substituting "self" for the `mid`. All POST parameters are optional unless required by the group. Only the organizer of the group may edit the member's `title` and `role` within the group. Those are the only things the organizer may edit. When requesting to set a role with `add_role` the member's previous role will be cleared. Members may edit all other fields of their own profiles with the exception of `title`, `add_role`, and `remove_role`. This method requires an HTTP POST.

operations.name: GetProfileGet

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

operations.summary: Retrieves a single group profile
operations.notes: Only authorization parameters are needed.

operations.name: ProfileDelete(LeaveGroup)

exit_comment.description: Optional message to the organizer when leaving

operations.summary: Deletes a member's group profile
operations.notes: All parameters are optional. Only the authorized member is permitted leave groups they do not organize. This method may not be used by organizers to remove members.

operations.name: PhotoDelete
operations.summary: Delete specified event photo
operations.notes: Only authorization parameters are needed. Authorized user must be the original poster of the photo or the organizer of the group the photo was posted in

operations.name: MemberPhotoDelete
operations.summary: Delete the specified member photo
operations.notes: Only authorization parameters are needed. Authorized user must be the member owning the photo

operations.name: GetCommentsv2

member_id.description: Return comments for the given member_ids, separated by commas

group_id.description: Return comments in groups with these ID numbers, separated by commas

event_id.description: Return comments on these events, separated by commas.

comment_id.description: Return comments for a given set of comment IDs, separated by commas

fields.description: Optionally accepts the value "member_photo" or "notifications"

time.description: Order by the time that each rating was posted (default: descending)

thread.description: Order by comment threads, those with the most recent activity are listed first. Only one event may be provided and desc not supported. Also note that with this ordering, *replies* are excluded from pagination accounting. Only top-level comments will be capped at the page size.

name.description: Order by the name of the member

operations.summary: This method returns messages that appear under "Talk about this Meetup". To post messages, see the corresponding write method.
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameters must be supplied with the request.

operations.name: EventCommentv2

notifications.description: Notification control for authorized member on this comment thread. "on" will result in notifications being sent. "off" will opt the member out of notifications for this comment thread. Defaults to "on" unless the member previous opted out of notifications on the thread.

in_reply_to.description: If this comment is a reply, the ID of the comment being replied to

event_id.description: The event related to this comment.

operations.summary: This method posts messages that appear under "Talk about this Meetup".
operations.notes: All of the required parameters must be supplied with the request, which must be an HTTP POST. The currently authenticated user must be a member of the group hosting the event

operations.name: GetEventCommentGet

fields.description: comma-separate list of optional fields

operations.name: EventCommentFlag

reason.description: Reason for flagging the comment. May be one of inappropriate, spam

operations.summary: This method creates a spam report for comment content
operations.notes: All required parameters must be supplied.

operations.name: EventCommentUnsubscribe
operations.summary: Unsubscribe to notifications for updates to a given comment thread
operations.notes: Only authorization parameters are needed. :id in the path should be the id of comment being replied to which you are unsubscribing to notifications from

operations.name: EventCommentSubscribe
operations.summary: Subscribe to notifications on updates to a given comment thread
operations.notes: Only authorization parameters are needed. :id in the path should be id of comment being replied to which you are subscribing to notifications for

operations.name: EventCommentLike
operations.summary: Like a given Event comment
operations.notes: Only authorization parameters are needed. :id in the path should be the id of the comment you are liking

operations.name: EventCommentUnlike

comment_id.description: Return likes for a given comment_id

created.description: Order by the time the member liked like comment (default: descending)

operations.summary: Api for listing likes of a given event comment
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameters must be supplied with the request.

operations.name: GetPhotoCommentsv2

photo_id.description: Return comments on these photos, separated by commas

member_id.description: Return comments for the given member_ids, separated by commas. The member ids must match up with one of the provided photo ids

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

time.description: Order by the time that each comment was posted

operations.summary: This method returns comments on meetup photos. To post messages, see the corresponding write method
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameters must be supplied by the request.

operations.name: PhotoCommentv2

photo_id.description: The photo related to this comment.

operations.summary: This method posts comments that appear below photos
operations.notes: All of the required parameters must be supplied with the request, which must be an HTTP POST. The currently authenticated user must be a member of the group hosting the photo

operations.name: GetRatingsv2

event_id.description: The ID of the event to fetch ratings data for

member_id.description: The ID of a member to filter ratings on

time.description: Order by the time that each rating was posted

rating.description: Order by the value for each rating posted

operations.summary: API method for accessing Meetup comments
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameters must be supplied with the request.

operations.name: EventRating

event_id.description: The ID of the event to fetch ratings data for

attendee_count.description: The number of attendees for the event (organizers/assistant organizers/co-organizers/event organizers/event hosts only)

operations.summary: This method allows members to posts rating for an event after it's occurred. Only permitted for members who rsvp'd "yes" or "maybe" to the event

operations.name: GetPhotoAlbums

photo_album_id.description: Return albums with these IDs, separated by commas

group_id.description: Return albums in groups with these ID, separated by commas

event_id.description: Return photo albums for these event ids, separated by commas

operations.summary: This method returns photo albums associated with Meetup groups. To create albums, see the corresponding write method.
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request.

operations.name: GetPhotos

member_id.description: Uploaded by members with these IDs, separated by commas

photo_album_id.description: Photo Album IDs, separated by commas

tagged.description: Tagged with members with these IDs, separated by commas

event_id.description: Event ids, separated by commas. These may contain alphanumeric autoscheduled event ids, only photos of reified events will be returned

fields.description: comma-delimited optional response properties such as member_country, member_city, member_state, and self

operations.summary: This method returns photos by member, group, album, event, photo ID, or tagged member.
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request.

operations.name: PhotoAlbum2

group_id.description: Group to create the album in

operations.summary: This method creates photo albums within a Meetup group
operations.notes: All of the required parameters must be supplied with the request, which must be an HTTP POST. The currently authenticated user must be an organizer (main, assistant, or co-) of the specified group

operations.name: GetOpenVenues

state.description: For the US, a valid 2 character state code

lon.description: A valid longitude, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles

zip.description: A valid US zip code, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles

lat.description: A valid latitude, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles

radius.description: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, default 25.0 -- maximum 100.0

text.description: Venues that contain the given term or terms somewhere in their content. Separate terms with " AND " for venues that have combined terms. Append a trailing * to treat this as a prefix search

group_urlname.description: Returns venues with location relative to the group associated with this urlname

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

distance.description: (default order) ordering is approximate and will not exactly match the values in the "distance" field.

operations.summary: Searches for public venues within a given geo space. To search for specific venues that your group has used, use the [Venues](/meetup_api/docs/2/venues) method
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request. If you are not able to provide a relative location you may supply a group_urlname which this method will use to infer location from. You can perform prefix searching by appending a * character to your query

operations.name: GetVenues

venue_id.description: multiple ids may be separated with commas

group_id.description: multiple ids may be separated with commas

event_id.description: multiple ids may be separated with commas

group_urlname.description: path to group from meetup.com, no slashes

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

distance.description: (default order) ordering is approximate and will not exactly match the values in the "distance" field.

operations.summary: Search for Meetup venues by one of your groups, events, or venue identifiers. For a full text search on public venues use [OpenVenues](/meetup_api/docs/2/open_venues).
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request. You can use either group_urlname or group_id to filter by groups but not both.

operations.name: GetRSVPsv2

rsvp.description: Filters response on RSVP status. "yes" if member RSVP'd yes otherwise "no"

event_id.description: Multiple alphanumeric ids may be separated with commas

fields.description: Parameter for requesting optional response properties, set to other_services for a list of third party services

event.description: the id or time of the event

social.description: social connections of the authenticated member

operations.summary: Query for Event RSVPs by event
operations.notes: At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request.

operations.name: RSVPCreate/Update

agree_to_refund.description: For events with fees, the authorized member must agree to the event's refund policy. This must be set to either true or false

answer_{qid}.description: Answers to event survey questions. Answers may not be longer than 250 characters. Organizers and hosts my not edit or create answers on behalf of members

rsvp.description: The RSVP setting - value must be either "yes", "no" or "waitlist"

opt_to_pay.description: For events with fees, the authorized member may opt to pay as part of the RSVP request. This may be set to true or false

guests.description: Number of guests also coming to the event.

event_id.description: The event that you are RSVP'ing to

comments.description: A comment to post along with the RSVP

member_id.description: Organizers and event hosts may RSVP on behalf of a member by specifying an ID here. As when editing RSVPs on the site, organizers may enter a "yes" for a member even if the event requires payment.

operations.summary: Creates or updates an existing RSVP
operations.notes:
At least one of the required parameter(s) must be supplied with the request.

The RSVP is recorded for the currently authenticated member account, unless a member_id is supplied, in which case the authenticated member must have permissions to edit the event or a host.

Member's RSVP'ing as themselves may supply answers to a Meetup event's survey questions by supplying answers as request parameters corresponding to question ids in the format `answer_{question_id}`. To discover available Meetup event survey questions, supply the [Events 2](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method with the 'fields' parameter set to 'survey_questions'.

Repeated attempts to RSVP to the same event given the same member credentials will result in an update to previous RSVP. The state of the event may or may not allow for this update to occur depending on the organizer-defined constraints and pre-requisites for the event.

Note: waitlist responses may be coerced into yes responses when there is space available and yes responses may be coerced into waitlist response when space is not.

If the event requires payment you are required to send an "agree_to_refund" parameter set to the true or false. This represents the authorized members agreement to understanding the event's refund policy.

operations.name: GetRSVPGet

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

operations.summary: Retrieve a single RSVP
operations.notes: Only authorization parameters are needed.

operations.name: GroupPhotoUpload

photo.description: The photo, encoded as multipart/form-data. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB

await.description: If true, this ensures a response will not be returned until the upload is accessible

group_id.description: Group ID for the target group. This may be used as an alternative to group_urlname

group_urlname.description: Group urlname. This may be used as an alternative to group_id

main.description: Set to 'true' to have this photo become the group's main photo. Set it to 'false' otherwise. Defaults to true

operations.summary: Uploads a new Meetup Group photo. To change other Group settings use the [Group Edit](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/#edit) endpoint
operations.notes: The request must be a POST of content-type multipart/form-data. The supplied photo will be added to the provided groups general photo album. If authenticating with OAuth, no parameters in the multipart form data should be included in the signature base string. You must be an organizer of the group in order to load a photo.

operations.name: MemberPhotoUpload

photo.description: The photo, encoded as multipart/form-data. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB

sync_photo.description: When set to true, this parameter will sync all of the group profile photos for the member with the provided photo_id

await.description: If true, this ensures a response will not be returned until the upload is accessible

sync_matching_photo.description: When set to true and main is set to true, this will replace all group profile photos matching the current photo with the provided replacement

main.description: Set to "true" to have this photo become the member's main profile photo. Otherwise, it will become the main photo only when none other is selected. If the authenticated member does not already have a main profile photo set it will remain so.

operations.summary: Uploads a photo to be associated with a Member
operations.notes: The request must be a POST of content-type multipart/form-data. The supplied photo will be added to the currently authenticated user's member profile. If authenticating with OAuth, no parameters in the multipart form data should be included in the signature base string.

operations.name: EventPhotoUpload

photo.description: The photo, encoded as multipart/form-data. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB

await.description: If true, this ensures a response will not be returned until the upload is accessible

photo_album_id.description: Identifier of an existing photo album, which may be an event or group album

event_id.description: Identifier of an event. If there is no album for this event, one will be created.

operations.summary: Uploads a photo for a given event
operations.notes: A photo album or event ID must be supplied with the request, which must be a POST of content-type `multipart/form-data`. The currently authenticated user must be a member of the group that is hosting the event. Parameters other than photo may be passed in as a query string or within the posted content. If authenticating with OAuth, no parameters in the multipart form data should be included in the signature base string
